body_content.explanation: a medical condition in which endometrial cells (= cells from the inside surface of the womb) grow in the muscle of the womb (= the organ in the body in which a baby develops), which can cause pain, bleeding, and other problems:
examples: Common causes of severe menstrual pain include endometriosis and adenomyosis.
Symptoms associated with uterine fibroids may be similar to those of patients with adenomyosis.
